summary: This document is a property deed transferring ownership of a parcel of land on Little St. James Island from a group of individuals represented by Creque Estates, Inc. to Arch W. Cummin for $470,000. It outlines the terms of the sale, including the rights and responsibilities of both parties regarding the property.

persons.name: Valerie Creque Rawson Nutting
persons.context: Valerie Creque Rawson Nutting is one of the individuals transferring ownership of the property.

persons.name: Alda Creque
persons.context: Alda Creque is identified as the president of Creque Estates, Inc., acting on behalf of the other grantors in the property transaction.

connections.description: Alda Creque is the president of Creque Estates, Inc., which is acting as the attorney-in-fact for the grantors.
Valerie Creque Rawson Nutting is one of the grantors represented by Alda Creque.
Arch W. Cummin is the buyer of the property from the group represented by Creque Estates, Inc.

locations: Little St. James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
19 East 88th Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a property deed dated August 13, 1901.
The grantors include multiple individuals from the Creque family.
Arch W. Cummin is the grantee of the property.
Creque Estates, Inc. acted as the attorney-in-fact for the grantors.
